item.title: [GRA][Containers & Orchestration] - Managed Private Registry maintenance notification
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 19, 08:00 - 19:00 UTC

Jun 4, 20:30 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed Private Registry offer.

This may temporarily affect Functionality.

Start time : 19/08/2025 08:00 UTC
End time : 19/08/2025 19:00 UTC
Service impact : Managed Private Registries will be set in read-only mode (only pull will be allowed) for less than 30 minutes.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will migrate some registries being on GRA region to a new infrastructure.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [GLOBAL][Containers & Orchestration] - End of life Kubernetes 1.28 notification
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 22, 07:00 UTC  -  Jul 24, 16:00 UTC

Jun 4, 20:15 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed Kubernetes Service.

Start time : 22/07/2025 07:00 UTC
End time : 24/07/2025 16:00 UTC
Service impact : Customers have to anticipate this maintenance in order to adapt to the new Kubernetes version.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, customers using Kubernetes version 1.28 will be migrated to version 1.29.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [SBG5][Containers & Orchestration] - Workflow Management service maintenance notification
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 24, 10:30 - 12:30 UTC

Jun 10, 16:44 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Workflow Management service, Mistral.
This may temporarily affect Functionality.

Start time : 24/06/2025 10:30 UTC
End time : 24/06/2025 12:30 UTC
Service impact :During this maintenance window for the Workflow Management service (Mistral), you may encounter the following impacts:
-Workflows in progress at the start of the maintenance will be stopped and will be restarted automatically after the maintenance is completed. We understand that this may cause a temporary disruption in your workflow processing, and we apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.
-Cron triggers (scheduled workflow executions) during the maintenance period will not be triggered. If you have any workflows scheduled to run during the maintenance window, we recommend rescheduling them to run outside of this timeframe to avoid any disruption.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be performing a maintenance on the Mistral service infrastructure. This maintenance is necessary to ensure the continued reliability and performance of our platform.
If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to our support team.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [WAW1][Public Cloud] - SSL Incident notification
item.description:
Jun 9, 13:05 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that the incident on our Public Cloud offering on WAW1 region has now been resolved.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 09/06/2025 12:30 UTC
End time : 09/06/2025 12:56 UTC
Root Cause : This incident was caused by a software malfunction.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.

Jun 9, 13:01 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jun 9, 12:50 UTC
Identified - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Public Cloud offering on WAW1 region.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 09/06/2025 12:30 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Customer wishing to list or manage Compute and MKS instances may temporarily encounter an SSL 500 error.
There is no impact on instances currently running.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

item.title: [SBG6/WAW2/BHS6/GRA6/GRA2/GRA1/GRA8][Compute - Instance] - Instance incident notification
item.description:
Jun 7, 02:51 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that the incident on our Compute Instance offering in SBG6, WAW2, BHS6, GRA6, GRA2, GRA1, GRA8 regions has now been resolved.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 06/06/2025 22:10 UTC
End time : 07/06/2025 02:22 UTC
Root Cause : This incident was caused by an issue with SSL certificate regeneration.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.

Jun 7, 01:40 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Jun 7, 01:25 UTC
Update - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : There are no more impact on the creation of new instances and volume attachments on existing ones in the following regions SBG6, SBG7, BHS6.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are actively working to resolve the incident and restore services as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Jun 7, 01:14 UTC
Update - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our public cloud offering, which is causing temporary availability issues on creation of new instances and volume attachments on existing ones in the following regions SBG6, WAW2, BHS6, GRA6, GRA2, GRA1, GRA8.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 06/06/2025 22:10 UTC.
Impacted Service(s) : Creation of new instances and volume attachments on existing instances are affected.
Customers Impact : You may experience difficulties during the creation of instances and volume attachments on existing instances in the regions mentioned.
Root Cause : This incident is caused by an issue with SSL certificate regeneration.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Jun 7, 01:05 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jun 7, 00:23 UTC
Update - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Public Cloud offering, which is causing temporary availability issues issues on creation of new instances and volume attachments on existing ones in SBG6, WAW2, BHS6, GRA6, GRA2, GRA1, GRA8 regions.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 06/06/2025 22:10 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Creation of new instances and volume attachments on existing instances are affected.
Customers impact : You may experience difficulties during the creation of VPS in the regions mentioned and volume attachments on existing instances.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Jun 6, 23:30 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an event affecting our Compute Instance offer in the following regions: SBG6, WAW2, BHS6, GRA6, GRA2, GRA1, GRA8.
Start time : 06/06/2025 22:10 UTC

Our teams are fully committed to investigating this issue and working towards a resolution as soon as possible. As investigations are ongoing, we will share any new findings or updates with you as soon as possible.
